snippet: The European Court of Human Rights ruled that Macedonia violated the rights of Khaled el-Masri when it arrested him and turned him over to the United States.
abstract: European Court of Human Rights rules that Macedonia violated rights of Khaled el-Masri, German man who was mistaken for terrorist, when it arrested him in 2003 and turned him over to United States; decision, hailed by Amnesty International as milestone against impunity, is final and cannot be appealed.

byline.contributor: Chris Cottrell contributed reporting from Berlin, and Scott Shane from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The European Court of Human Rights ruled that Macedonia violated the rights of Khaled el-Masri when it arrested him and turned him over to the United States.

headline.seo: Europe Court Finds Violation in C.I.A. Rendition
headline.main: Court Finds Rights Violation in C.I.A. Rendition Case
headline.print_headline: Court Finds Rights Violation in C.I.A. Rendition Case

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
